content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given the structure of the game, it seems that choosing R consistently would result in higher earnings compared to choosing B consistently. This is because when my opponent chooses R and I choose B, I only earn 20$, while if they pick B and I pick R, I earn 40$. However, when we both pick R, we both get 45$, which is the highest payout for a single round.

However, in a repeated game like this one, it's important to consider strategies that will maximize earnings over the long run. One such strategy is known as "Tit-for-Tat" where you start by cooperating (choosing R) and then do whatever your opponent did on the previous round. This strategy encourages cooperation while also punishing defection (choosing B).

In this case, if I choose R first and my opponent chooses B, they will then be incentivized to choose R in the next round to earn 40$ (assuming I stick to Tit-for-Tat strategy), and we can continue earning 45$ each time we both choose R thereafter.

However, it's important to note that neither of us knows whether the other will follow a cooperative strategy like Tit-for-Tat, so there is some element of uncertainty. But given the structure of the game, it seems rational to start by choosing R (cooperating) and then adjusting strategies based on my opponent's responses.

Therefore, I choose R{R} as my initial strategy.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

Given that my opponent has chosen B in the first round, I will now choose R for the second round using the Tit-for-Tat strategy. If my opponent sticks to their choice of B, I will earn 40$ in the next round, which is a higher payout compared to if we both stick with our initial choices and I continue to earn 0$. However, if my opponent switches to choosing R, we can both start earning 45$ per round from then on.

Therefore, I choose R{R}.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Since my opponent has chosen R and we both earned 45$ in the previous round, I will continue to choose R for the next round as well, following the cooperative Tit-for-Tat strategy. By doing so, we can both earn 45$ per round for as long as we both stick with our choice of R.

Therefore, I choose R{R}.
